form.label: Replicated Index Detail
form.searchTemplate: `fb_data_from_today` `_fb_summary_recs($host$, $index$)` | extract auto=f fb_extract_bucket_type_time_source | fields _time, sizeOnDiskMB, path, bucket_type, bucket_primary_guid, guId | bucket _time span=1d

html.div:
The contents of this dashboard relate to the Clustering (sometimes called Index Replication) feature of Splunk. This is available in versions of Splunk starting with 5.0.
Note: Environments not making use of clustering will simply not have any replicated data shown on the graphs.
The first row of panels represents configuration data. Most promiment is the mode of the selected host. In the Replication Settings panel, a value of auto in the "This Index" position indicates that the system-wide setting should be honored.
Numerical data on the second row is broken out to give show the amount of disk space consumed by index buckets arising locally (that is, data indexed natively by this host), vs buckets which are replicated from other nodes in the cluster. In this way, it's possible to see the overall impact of clustering on the disk storage requirements.
The pie chart in the bottom left is broken out by the splunk_server field of the indexer which originally indexed the data (this name can be, but is not required to be, the hostname of the system).
On the bottom right is a time-trended graph showing the relative proportion of data indexed locally by the selected indexer, compared to the amount of data being replicated to this indexer from other members of the cluster.

input.label: Host
input.populatingSearch: | inputlookup fb_hostname_index_cache | dedup orig_host | sort orig_host

input.label: Index
input.populatingSearch: | inputlookup fb_hostname_index_cache | search orig_host=$host$ | dedup orig_index | sort orig_index

single.title: Locally Indexed Data
single.searchPostProcess: `_fb_where_today` | search NOT bucket_type="rb" | stats max(sizeOnDiskMB) AS sizeOnDiskMB by path | stats sum(sizeOnDiskMB) AS indexed | `_fb_mbytes_pretty(indexed)`

single.title: Replicated Data
single.searchPostProcess: `_fb_where_today` | search bucket_type="rb" | stats max(sizeOnDiskMB) AS sizeOnDiskMB by path | stats count, sum(sizeOnDiskMB) AS replicated | fillnull value=0 replicated | `_fb_mbytes_pretty(replicated)`

single.title: Total (Local + Replicated)
single.searchPostProcess: `_fb_where_today` | stats max(sizeOnDiskMB) AS sizeOnDiskMB by path | stats sum(sizeOnDiskMB) AS Total | `_fb_mbytes_pretty(Total)`

chart.title: Source of Indexed Data
chart.searchPostProcess: `_fb_where_today` | extract auto=f fb_extract_hot_bucket | eval guid=coalesce(bucket_primary_guid, guId) | join type=left guid [ | rest /services/server/info | rename splunk_server AS host ] | stats max(sizeOnDiskMB) AS sizeOnDiskMB by host, path | stats sum(sizeOnDiskMB) AS MBytes by host

chart.title: Local vs. Replicated Data Over Time (last 30 days)
chart.searchString: `_fb_summary_recs($host$, $index$)` | extract auto=f fb_extract_bucket_type_time_source | fields _time, sizeOnDiskMB, path, bucket_type, guId | bucket _time span=1d | extract auto=f fb_extract_hot_bucket | stats max(sizeOnDiskMB) AS sizeOnDiskMB by _time, path, bucket_type | eval bucket_type=if(bucket_type=="rb", "Replicated", "Indexed") | timechart span=1d sum(sizeOnDiskMB) AS "Disk Usage" by bucket_type
